org.apache.derbyTesting.junit

Class IndexStatsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.IndexStatsUtil

  • public class IndexStatsUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for obtaining index statistics and doing asserts on them.

    This implementation assumes all tables/indexes belong to the current schema.

    The timeout value is used to make the utility more resilient to differences in timing due to varying scheduling decisions, processor speeds, etc. If the system table contains the wrong number of statistics objects for the query, it will be queried repeatedly until the right number of statistics objects is obtained or the query times out.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Immutable class representing index statistics.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexStatsUtil

        public IndexStatsUtil(java.sql.Connection con)
        Creates an instance querying the given database with no timeout set.

        Querying with no timeout means that if there are too few or too many statistics objects matching the query, a failure will be raised immediately.

        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database to query

      • IndexStatsUtil

        public IndexStatsUtil(java.sql.Connection con,
                      long timeout)
        Creates an instance querying the given database with the specified timeout value.
        Parameters:
        con - connection to the database to query
        timeout - the longest time to wait to see if the expectations for a query are met (milliseconds)

      • querySystemTable

        private IndexStatsUtil.IdxStats[] querySystemTable(java.lang.String conglomId,
                                                   boolean isTable,
                                                   int expectedCount)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Queries the system table SYS.SYSSTATISTICS for statistics associated with a specific table or index.
        Parameters:
        conglomId - conglomerate id (UUID)
        isTable - tells if the conglomerate is a table or an index
        expectedCount - the number of statistics objects expected, use NO_EXPECTATION to return whatever matches the query immediately
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if obtaining the statistics fails

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getIdToNameMap()
                                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Generates a map from ids to names for conglomerates in the database.

        Convenience method, used for better reporting.

        Returns:
        Mappings from conglomerate id to conglomerate name.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if accessing the system tables fail

      • awaitChange

        private void awaitChange(IndexStatsUtil.IdxStats[] current,
                         long timeout)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Waits until all given statistics entries have been changed, or until the call times out.

        NOTE: The method is built on the assumption that the UUIDs of statistics objects aren't reused. That is, when statistics are updated, the old row in SYS.SYSSTATISTICS will be dropped and a new row will be inserted.

        Parameters:
        current - the statistics that must change / be replaced
        timeout - maximum number of milliseconds to wait before giving up
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if obtaining statistics fails
